results.title: Change in alpha1 HDL concentration predicts progression in coronary artery stenosis.
results.text_hl: OBJECTIVE: We examined the effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@-@CHEMICAL_Niacin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009525 @@@niacin@@@ and antioxidant vitamins on changes in high-density lipoprotein (HDL) subpopulations and alterations in @<m>DISEASE_Coronary_Stenosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D023921 @@@coronary artery stenosis@@@, as assessed by angiography.

citations.NLM: Asztalos BF, Batista M, Horvath KV, Cox CE, Dallal GE, Morse JS, Brown GB, Schaefer EJ. Change in alpha1 HDL concentration predicts progression in coronary artery stenosis. Arterioscler Thromb Vasc Biol. 2003 May 1;23(5):847-52. PMID: 12637338
citations.BibTeX: @article{12637338, title={Change in alpha1 HDL concentration predicts progression in coronary artery stenosis.}, author={Asztalos BF and Batista M and Horvath KV and Cox CE and Dallal GE and Morse JS and Brown GB and Schaefer EJ}, journal={Arterioscler Thromb Vasc Biol}, volume={23}, number={5}, pages={847-52}}

results.title: [Atherosclerosis and simvastatin: new questions for the new millennium].
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Lipids @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008055 @@@Lipid@@@ blood levels have a tight correlation with the risk of coronary events, and the results of many trials on @CHEMICAL_Lipids @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008055 @@@lipid@@@-lowering therapy (and particularly on @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@) demonstrated a significant reduction in total and cardiac mortality, and in the incidence of @DISEASE_Myocardial_Infarction @DISEASE_MESH:D009203 @@@myocardial infarction@@@ and coronary events; even the progression of @<m>DISEASE_Coronary_Stenosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D023921 @@@coronary stenosis@@@ has been reduced by treatment with statins.

citations.NLM: Tubaro M, Guido V, Sciarra L, Mustilli M, Carbone MA, D'Errico F. [Atherosclerosis and simvastatin: new questions for the new millennium]. Ann Ital Med Int. 2000 Jan-Mar;15(1):108-14. PMID: 10842900
citations.BibTeX: @article{10842900, title={[Atherosclerosis and simvastatin: new questions for the new millennium].}, author={Tubaro M and Guido V and Sciarra L and Mustilli M and Carbone MA and D'Errico F}, journal={Ann Ital Med Int}, volume={15}, number={1}, pages={108-14}}

results.title: The Effects of Statin and Niacin on Plaque Stability, Plaque Regression, Inflammation and Oxidative Stress in Patients With Mild to Moderate Coronary Artery Stenosis
results.text_hl: It focused on @DISEASE_Coronary_Aneurysm @DISEASE_MESH:D003323 @@@coronary plaque@@@ regression in @DISEASE_Angina_Pectoris @DISEASE_MESH:D000787 @@@angina@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ who had mild to moderate degree of @<m>DISEASE_Coronary_Stenosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D023921 @@@coronary stenosis@@@ and who received @CHEMICAL_Niacin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009525 @@@niacin@@@ 1,000 mg plus @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ 40 mg or @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ 40 mg alone.

citations.NLM: Lee K, Ahn TH, Kang WC, Han SH, Choi IS, Shin EK. The Effects of Statin and Niacin on Plaque Stability, Plaque Regression, Inflammation and Oxidative Stress in Patients With Mild to Moderate Coronary Artery Stenosis Korean Circ J. 2011 Nov;41(11):641-8. PMID: 22194758
citations.BibTeX: @article{22194758, title={The Effects of Statin and Niacin on Plaque Stability, Plaque Regression, Inflammation and Oxidative Stress in Patients With Mild to Moderate Coronary Artery Stenosis}, author={Lee K and Ahn TH and Kang WC and Han SH and Choi IS and Shin EK}, journal={Korean Circ J}, volume={41}, number={11}, pages={641-8}}

results.title: [Preventive effect of simvastatin, a competitive inhibitor of 3-hydroxy-3-methylglutaryl coenzyme A reductase, on coronary atherosclerosis in cholesterol-fed rabbits].
results.text_hl: Twenty-seven Japanese white @SPECIES_9986 @@@rabbits@@@ were divided according to dosage of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ into four groups as follows, group P (placebo, 5 @SPECIES_9986 @@@rabbits@@@), group MK 1 (@<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ 1mg/kg, 5 @SPECIES_9986 @@@rabbits@@@), group MK 3 (@<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ 3mg/kg, 6 @SPECIES_9986 @@@rabbits@@@) and group MK 5 (@<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ 5mg/kg, 5 @SPECIES_9986 @@@rabbits@@@).

citations.NLM: Oogushi K. [Preventive effect of simvastatin, a competitive inhibitor of 3-hydroxy-3-methylglutaryl coenzyme A reductase, on coronary atherosclerosis in cholesterol-fed rabbits]. Fukuoka Igaku Zasshi. 1991 Feb;82(2):36-47. PMID: 2022360
citations.BibTeX: @article{2022360, title={[Preventive effect of simvastatin, a competitive inhibitor of 3-hydroxy-3-methylglutaryl coenzyme A reductase, on coronary atherosclerosis in cholesterol-fed rabbits].}, author={Oogushi K}, journal={Fukuoka Igaku Zasshi}, volume={82}, number={2}, pages={36-47}}

results.title: Niacin plus Simvastatin Reduces Coronary Stenosis Progression Among Patients with Metabolic Syndrome Despite a Modest Increase in Insulin Resistance: A Subgroup Analysis of the HDL-Atherosclerosis Treatment Study (HATS).
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Niacin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009525 @@@Niacin@@@ plus @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ Reduces @<m>DISEASE_Coronary_Stenosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D023921 @@@Coronary Stenosis@@@ Progression Among @SPECIES_9606 @@@Patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Metabolic_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D024821 @@@Metabolic Syndrome@@@ Despite a Modest Increase in @DISEASE_Insulin_Resistance @DISEASE_MESH:D007333 @@@Insulin Resistance@@@: A Subgroup Analysis of the HDL-Atherosclerosis Treatment Study (HATS).

citations.NLM: Vittone F, Chait A, Morse JS, Fish B, Brown BG, Zhao XQ. Niacin plus Simvastatin Reduces Coronary Stenosis Progression Among Patients with Metabolic Syndrome Despite a Modest Increase in Insulin Resistance: A Subgroup Analysis of the HDL-Atherosclerosis Treatment Study (HATS). results.title: Pseudoxanthoma elasticum and familial hypercholesterolemia: a deleterious combination of cardiovascular risk factors.
results.text_hl: Treatment with @CHEMICAL_Ezetimibe @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069438 @@@ezetimibe@@@/@<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ 10/60mg/day, maintained over a 4.5-year period, reduced of LDL-C and the @DISEASE_Myocardial_Ischemia @DISEASE_MESH:D017202 @@@myocardial ischemic@@@ area.

citations.NLM: Pisciotta L, Tarugi P, Borrini C, Bellocchio A, Fresa R, Guerra D, Quaglino D, Ronchetti I, Calandra S, Bertolini S. Pseudoxanthoma elasticum and familial hypercholesterolemia: a deleterious combination of cardiovascular risk factors. Atherosclerosis. 2010 May;210(1):173-6. PMID: 20018285
